content: Sonu Kashyap, who, driven by his thirst for revenge, roamed the streets of Lucknow for the next 10 years in search of the man who had insulted his mother.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Flags Irregularities In Widow Pension And Disability Aid
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Monday ordered a full review of the city's welfare schemes, citing "serious irregularities" in widow pensions and disability support handed out under the previous Aam Aadmi Party administration.

title: Skeletons in the closet
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Not immediately worried about China constructing dam on Brahmaputra: Assam CM Himanta
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Kanwar Yatra: SC directs eateries to display only license & registration info only
content: The Supreme Court has instructed dhaba and restaurant owners along the Kanwar Yatra route to adhere to Uttar Pradesh's mandate of displaying license and registration information. This directive follows a petition arguing that QR code requirements, revealing owner identities, could lead to discriminatory profiling.

title: Mumbai blasts: LeT or IM, household utensils or pressure cookers? Questions linger
content: The 2006 Mumbai train blasts case remains shrouded in controversy due to conflicting claims from the Maharashtra ATS and the Mumbai crime branch. While the ATS implicated SIMI and LeT, the crime branch later pointed to an Indian Mujaheeddin module. Key evidence like pressure cookers, allegedly used in the blasts, was questioned in court.

title: 'Milestone moment': Army receives first batch of Apache helicopters from US
content: Three AH-64E Apache attack helicopters, part of a Rs 5,691 crore deal with the US, have arrived at Hindon Air Force Station, enhancing the Indian Army's offensive capabilities. These "tanks in the air" will be stationed in Jodhpur, where the Army raised its first Apache squadron. The remaining three Apaches are expected by the end of 2025.

title: 'We're going to crush your economy': US Senator warns India, China, Brazil
content: US Senators Graham and Blumenthal, along with former President Trump, have warned India, China, and Brazil of potential economic sanctions, including tariffs up to 500%, for continuing to purchase discounted Russian oil and gas. These actions aim to cut off Russia's revenue amid the Ukraine war, with Trump threatening 100% secondary tariffs if a peace deal isn't reached soon.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk admits he had been ‚Äòliving in denial‚Äô
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared ‚Äúgame on,‚Äù signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: 2006 Mumbai bomb blasts: Maharashtra govt moves SC against Bombay HC verdict acquitting 12
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear Maharashtra's plea on July 25, challenging the Bombay High Court's acquittal of all 12 accused in the 2006 Mumbai train blasts case. The state, represented by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, emphasizes the urgency of the matter, especially since eight of the acquitted have been released. The Bombay High Court cited prosecution failures and procedural lapses in its decision, sparking political debate and concerns over justice.

title: Watch: Stranded UK fighter jet finally departs Kerala after month-long stay
content: A British F-35B Lightning fighter jet, grounded in Kerala due to a hydraulic fault since June 14, has successfully taken off after repairs. A UK technical team completed the work at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, with support from Indian authorities. The aircraft's extended stay garnered public attention, while the UK government expressed gratitude for India's collaboration.

title: Microsoft SharePoint hack: Who is at risk; expert warns ‚Äòanybody who's got a ...'
content: Microsoft has released a fix for a critical security flaw in its SharePoint software. Hackers actively exploited this vulnerability, targeting businesses and US government agencies. The flaw, a 'zero-day' vulnerability, allowed full access to SharePoint file systems. While a patch is available for newer versions, a solution for SharePoint Server 2016 is still in development.

title: China‚Äôs rare earth curbs hit: Apple AirPods production faces hurdles in India
content: Production of Apple AirPods in India may face challenges. This is due to China's restrictions on rare earth metal exports. Foxconn's Telangana facility is facing limited availability of dysprosium. Foxconn has raised the supply shortage issue with the Telangana government. The government has escalated the matter to DPIIT. Foxconn is seeking help to get the end user certificate certified.

title: Son's answer to mother being slapped: Murder a decade later in UP's Kalyanpur
content: In Lucknow's Kalyanpur, a decade-old grudge culminated in the daylight murder of a 32-year-old man. Police arrested five individuals, including the main accused, Anup alias Sonu Kashyap, who sought revenge for a 2015 incident where the victim allegedly assaulted his mother. The group attacked Manoj Kumar with iron rods and sticks.

title: Raj Thackeray's men remove Gujarati display board at Navi Mumbai BJP MLA's office
content: In Navi Mumbai, MNS members, joined by other political party workers, successfully pressured the removal of a Gujarati signboard from a Gujarat BJP MLA's office. Following an ultimatum, the group demonstrated at the NRI Sagari police station, demanding a Marathi replacement and action against those disrespecting Marathi identity.

title: Popcorn powered future: Musk‚Äôs robot goes viral; says, 'this will become normal in a few years'
content: Elon Musk showcased Tesla Optimus serving popcorn, marking progress toward robots assisting with daily tasks. The robot's precise movements at the Tesla Diner highlight advancements in motor control and user interaction. Musk envisions Optimus becoming commonplace, aiding in chores and caregiving, though challenges in full autonomy remain before its projected 2026 commercial release.

title: Bihar hospital shooting: 2 murder suspects shot in encounter with cops; 7 held so far
content: Two suspects in the daylight murder of gangster Chandan Mishra at a Patna hospital were injured in a police encounter in Arrah. The suspects were part of a group that fatally shot Mishra, who was out on parole for surgery. Following arrests in Kolkata, police traced the gang, leading to the encounter and ongoing interrogations of ten suspects.

title: ‚ÄòAvatar: Fire and Ash‚Äô trailer to debut with ‚ÄòFantastic Four‚Äô in theatres
content: James Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' trailer will debut exclusively in theaters this weekend, attached to 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps'. The film, releasing December 19, 2025, introduces new Na'vi tribes and a threat from the Ash People. Following the success of its predecessors, this third installment aims to cross the $2 billion mark, solidifying the franchise's box office dominance.

title: Hope to gift one someday: Sushmita Sen‚Äôs ex says can‚Äôt afford her diamonds
content: Despite ending their romantic relationship in 2021, Sushmita Sen and Rohman Shawl maintain a strong friendship, frequently seen together at events. Rohman humorously confessed he can't yet afford the 22-carat diamond Sushmita admires. They began as friends and remain so, with Rohman clarifying he's currently single but open to love, though assumptions about his relationship status complicate dating.

title: Iran admits nuclear facilities 'seriously damaged'; Trump warns 'will do it again'
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi admitted that US missile strikes last month caused "serious damage" to Iran's nuclear infrastructure, halting uranium enrichment. Despite the destruction, Iran vows to rebuild and resume enrichment, viewing it as a matter of national pride. President Trump responded by claiming vindication and demanding an apology from CNN for downplaying the strikes' effectiveness.

title: VP quits abruptly: Dhankhar caught govt unaware by allowing notice against Varma in RS
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar abruptly resigned, citing health reasons, just before completing two years in office. His resignation, submitted to President Droupadi Murmu, took effect immediately. The move has sparked speculation, especially given his recent cardiac procedure and fainting spell, despite appearing well on Monday. Dhankhar, who assumed office in August 2022, was expected to serve until 2027.

title: ‚ÄòSubject to divine intervention‚Äô: VP Dhankhar‚Äôs old video resurfaces; 10 days later he quits
content: Vice-president Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday evening, citing medical reasons, cutting short his term scheduled to end in August 2027. His resignation, which came on the first day of Parliament's Monsoon session, has sparked political speculation. An old video resurfaced where Dhankhar mentioned his retirement in August 2027, "subject to divine intervention".

title: Israeli strikes on Syria, Gaza: Caught off guard, Trump called Netanyahu to 'rectify'
content: US President Donald Trump expressed surprise at Israel's military actions in Syria and Gaza. White House confirmed Trump discussed the matter with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Israel stated the Syria operation aimed to pressure Syrian forces. A US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Syria has commenced. Netanyahu attributed the Gaza church strike to a stray missile.

title: Fans swoon over Darnell nurse‚Äôs wife's wedding post amid Oilers exit rumors
content: Darnell Nurse's personal life is in the spotlight as his wife Mikayla shares a loving moment from Warren Foegele's wedding. Simultaneously, the Edmonton Oilers are reportedly exploring trade options for Nurse, despite his key role on the team. His $9.25 million contract is a significant factor as the Oilers aim to optimize their roster for a Stanley Cup run.

title: IND vs ENG: England cricket team hires ‚Äòno d***heads‚Äô guru ‚Äì details inside
content: England's cricket team has enlisted Gilbert Enoka, the former All Blacks mental skills coach, to fortify the squad's mental resilience. Enoka, known for his "no dickheads" policy, aims to foster a team-first environment as England faces crucial series against India and Australia, including the Ashes. He previously worked with New Zealand cricket and other elite sports teams.

title: IND vs ENG: India out to achieve first-ever feat in their history - in numbers
content: India face England in the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford, with Jasprit Bumrah set to play despite workload concerns. Siraj all but confirmed Bumrah's participation in the Test that starts July 23, while India grapples with selection challenges due to injuries to Akash Deep and Nitish Kumar Reddy. India trail the series 1-2 after three Tests.

title: WCL | 'Don't play against us in ICC tournaments, Olympics' - Ex-Pakistan skipper
content: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has strongly criticized Yuvraj Singh's India Champions for withdrawing from the World Championship of Legends match against Pakistan. Butt questioned the message sent to cricket fans and challenged India to boycott Pakistan in all tournaments, including the Olympics.

title: 'They hate straight, white CEOs': MAGA host says Leftists behind Coldplay saga
content: Pro-MAGA commentator Jack Posobiec said the backlash against Astronomer's former CEO, Andy Byron, stemmed from Leftists' animosity towards white, straight CEOs. Andy Byron resigned after a video of him with the company's HR chief at a Coldplay concert went viral, sparking outrage. The company is now under new leadership, with Pete DeJoy taking over as CEO.

title: IND vs ENG | ‚ÄòDekho, desh ke liye khelta hoon‚Äô - Mohammed Siraj
content: Mohammed Siraj expressed his disappointment over India's Lord's Test defeat, recalling his previous success at the same venue in 2021. He emphasized his commitment to giving his all for the country and his desire to play as many matches as possible. Siraj also credited his fitness to the Almighty, looking forward to the upcoming Test at Old Trafford.

title: New twist! Pakistan refuse to share points, say 'India backed out'
content: The World Champions of Legends (WCL) announced the cancellation of the highly anticipated India-Pakistan match at Edgbaston, citing their inability to conduct the game. The decision follows the refusal of several Indian players, including Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan, to participate due to heightened geo-political tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Gurgaon teen stabs boy 20 times with scissors
content: In Gurgaon, a 16-year-old boy was apprehended for allegedly murdering his seven-year-old neighbor. The gruesome act involved stabbing the younger boy nearly 20 times with scissors, concealing the body near the KMP Expressway.

title: Gita Gopinath quits IMF, to return to Harvard in August
content: Gita Gopinath, the IMF's First Deputy Managing Director, will depart at the end of August to return to Harvard University. Her exit, surprising to many, opens an opportunity for the U.S. Treasury to propose a successor amidst global trade dynamic shifts. Gopinath, the first female chief economist, joined the IMF in 2019 and was promoted in 2022.

title: 'Who is to be blamed?': Paid Rs 2.5 lakh to represent India, dream snatched by admin mistake
content: Indian sprinter Devyaniba Zala was excluded from the 400m race at the World University Games due to a last-minute entry alteration, despite being on the initial list. Zala, who had trained for over a year and paid Rs 2.5 lakhs, expressed her frustration over the administrative error.

title: 'People were screaming, running': Eyewitnesses recall Bangladesh air crash horror
content: A Bangladesh Air Force fighter jet crashed into the Milestone School and College in Dhaka, resulting in a devastating scene of fire and panic. The accident claimed the lives of at least 25 people, including students and the pilot, and left over 170 injured.

title: As Dhankhar resigns, NDA in huddle over VP post; who‚Äôs in the running?
content: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday, citing health reasons, creating a vacancy for a new vice-president. His resignation surprised the BJP-led NDA, which will now consider potential candidates. The BJP is expected to select a nominee from a pool of governors, senior leaders, or Union ministers. Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh is among those being considered.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 150 points.

title: IND vs ENG: 'McCullum‚Äôs ‚Äòtoo nice‚Äô jibe lit fire under England on Day 5' - Brook
content: Harry Brook revealed that Brendon McCullum's comment about England being "too nice" fueled their aggressive approach on Day 5 against India at Lord's. Brook stated that the team decided to shed their friendly image after witnessing Indian players confront their teammates. England aimed to apply pressure without resorting to personal attacks or unsportsmanlike conduct.

title: 'Saiyaara' crosses Rs 100 crore mark; sees minor dip on first Monday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama, 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has remarkably grossed over Rs 100 crore in just four days. Defying expectations, the film has become a sleeper hit of 2025, setting a new benchmark for films featuring debutant actors. Its emotional narrative and strong performances have resonated with audiences and industry peers alike.

title: Aadhaar, voter ID & ration cards can‚Äôt be considered for SIR: EC
content: The Election Commission of India disagreed with the Supreme Court's view on using Aadhaar, voter ID, and ration cards for Bihar's electoral roll Special Summary Revision. EC stated these documents are unreliable. Aadhaar is just an identity proof. Many fake ration cards exist. Using current voter cards would defeat the purpose of the special drive.

title: Buried beneath new tiles: Man‚Äôs body found after switched off phone raises alarm
content: In Nalasopara (east), a shocking discovery unfolded as the body of 32-year-old Vijay Chauhan was found buried within his own home, prompting a police investigation. Suspicion arose when Chauhan's brothers noticed newly laid floor tiles and the unexplained absence of his wife, Chaman Devi.

title: Richard Tillman‚Äôs mental health crisis ends in fiery arrest
content: Richard Tillman, brother of the late Pat Tillman, faces arson charges after allegedly setting fire to a San Jose post office. His family reveals a long battle with severe, untreated mental illness, evidenced by erratic online behavior. They claim the mental health system failed to provide adequate support despite visible signs of his deteriorating condition, leading to this crisis.

title: Trump admin releases MLK Jr., Hillary probe files; what do they reveal?
content: The Trump administration has released thousands of documents related to the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. in 1968 and Hillary Clinton's email controversy. The King files detail the investigation into James Earl Ray and international intelligence cooperation. The Clinton documents reveal alleged FBI negligence in investigating her handling of classified information, raising questions about political influence.

title: 'Stabbed 14 times': Jaipur man butchered in public, accused posts 'revenge' boast
content: Jaipur witnessed widespread protests after the brutal murder of Vipin Kumar, allegedly by Mohammad Anas, disrupting traffic on the Jaipur-Agra highway. Accused Anas, a known history-sheeter, was arrested after attempting to seize a police officer's weapon and was shot in the leg.

title: 'Sledging fired up Virat Kohli, but it rattled Shubman Gill'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar supports Shubman Gill to rebound in the fourth Test against England despite India trailing 1-2. Manjrekar acknowledged Gill's leadership while noting his aggression differs from Virat Kohli's. He observed Gill's frustration during the Lord's Test and how sledging might have affected his batting.

title: 2006 Mumbai train blasts: Torture of accused barbaric, inhuman, says HC
content: The Bombay High Court acquitted all accused in the train blasts case, deeming confessions extracted by the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) as inadmissible due to "barbaric and inhuman" torture. Accusations included severe physical abuse and psychological coercion, leading the court to question the validity of the confessions. The court also highlighted procedural lapses in invoking MCOCA, further undermining the prosecution's case.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Kamboj has control, and bowling brain like Zaheer, Bumrah' - Ashwin
content: Haryana seamer Anshul Kamboj has been drafted into India's Test team as cover for injured Arshdeep Singh and Akash Deep. R Ashwin believes Kamboj's first-class form and ability to bowl long spells make him a valuable asset in England. Ashwin also praises Kamboj's understanding and execution of plans, comparing him to Zaheer Khan and Jasprit Bumrah.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for July 22 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying DLF and Bajaj FinServ. DLF, exhibiting a flag pattern, is expected to break out upwards, targeting 880 with a stop loss at 838. Bajaj FinServ, having broken out of a triangle pattern, aims for 2135, supported by positive momentum and a stop loss at 2017.

title: ‚ÄòExtreme lack of effort‚Äô: Hillary Clinton email row back in spotlight
content: Senator Chuck Grassley released declassified documents revealing the FBI's allegedly inadequate investigation into Hillary Clinton's email server. Grassley claims the FBI, under Comey, showed a lack of due diligence and contrasted this with the Trump-Russia probe. The documents suggest potential interference by the Obama administration and raise questions about the handling of classified information.

Here are the strengths and weaknesses of the teams .

title: How to quit your smartphone addiction, guided by science
content: study: people are becoming increasingly addicted to smartphones . in every country tested, and in all ages, nearly 57% of those asked admitted to being addicted to their phones . people are getting tired of their smartphone behaviours, a social scientist says . if you are addicted, you can test whether you are on the Smartphone Addiction Scale .

title: Ahmedabad airport receives bomb threat
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Dhankhar resigns as VP: Cong points to 'deeper reasons' behind sudden exit
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .
